snippet.title: Prince Philip's controversial gaffes
snippet.content: SOME OF PRINCE PHILIP'S FOOT-IN-MOUTH MOMENTS: "Do you still throw spears at each other?" - Meeting Aboriginal leader Ivan Brim on a 2002 visit to Australia. "Oh no, I might catch some ghastly disease." - After being asked to pat a koala in Australia in 1992. "If you stay here much longer, you'll all be slitty-eyed." Speaking to British exchange students in Beijing in 1986. "You managed not to get eaten, then?" - Suggesting a student who had been trekking in Papua New Guinea in 1998 was at risk of cannibalism. "Deaf? If you are near there, no wonder you are deaf." - Speaking to a group of deaf children standing next to a steel drum band in Wales in 1999. "You look like a suicide bomber." - To a young female officer wearing a bullet-proof vest at the Isle of Lewis in 2002. "Do you know they're now producing eating dogs for anorexics?" - To wheelchair-bound blind woman Susan Edwards and her guide dog Natalie outside Exeter Cathedral in 2002. "You're too fat to be an astronaut." - To 13-year-old aspiring astronaut Andrew Adams, Salford 2001. "Ah, so this is feminist corner then." - Joining a group of female Labour MPs at a Buckingham Palace drinks party in 2000 wearing name badges reading 'Ms'. "You look as if you're ready for the bed." - Greeting the Nigerian secretary-general of the Commonwealth, who was wearing ceremonial robes to a state dinner. "Are we going to need ear plugs?" - After being told Madonna was singing the Die another Day theme song in 2002. "So who's on drugs here?... HE looks as if he's on drugs." - To a 14-year-old Bangladeshi youth club member in 2002. "It looks as if it was put in by an Indian." - Thoughts on a fuse box at a factory in Scotland in 1999. "If a cricketer, for instance, suddenly decided to go into a school and batter a lot of people to death with a cricket bat, which he could do very easily, I mean, are you going to ban cricket bats?" - Gun control musings following the Dunblame shooting in 1996. "How do you keep the natives off the booze long enough to get them through the test?" - To a Scottish driving instructor in 1995. "If it has got four legs and it is not a chair, if it has got two wings and it flies but is not an aeroplane, and if it swims and it is not a submarine, what is it? Answer: A Cantonese dinner." - Views on Asian food at a 1986 World Wildlife Fund meeting attended by some Chinese. "You ARE a woman, aren't you?" - In Kenya, in 1984, after accepting a gift from a local woman. "Everybody was saying we must have more leisure. Now they are complaining they are unemployed." - During the 1981 recession. "(Children) go to school because their parents don't want them in the house." - Made in October 2013 in the presence of Malala Yousafzai, who survived an assassination attempt by the Taliban after campaigning for the right of girls to go to school. "Just take the f***ing picture." - losing patience with an RAF photographer at events to mark the 75th anniversary of the Battle of Britain in July 2015 "I declare this thing open, whatever it is." - On a 1969 visit to Canada. "British women can't cook." - Culinary thoughts in 1966. "I'm just a bloody amoeba." - On the Queen's decision that their children should be called Windsor, not Mountbatten. "Yak, yak, yak; come on get a move on." - To the Queen, shouted from the deck of Britannia in Belize in 1994 as she spoke to guests. Originally published as
